mods.abstract: Selected performances from Eddy Arnold's Thereby Hangs A Tale album. Tom Dooley and Nellie Sits A-Waitin' were recorded on July 13, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), John D. Loudermilk (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), and Buddy Harman (drums). Tennessee Stud was recorded on April 27, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), John D. Loudermilk (guitar), Ray Edenton (guitar), Jerry Byrd (bass), and Buddy Harman and Douglas Kirkham (drums). The Battle Of Little Big Horn and The Red Headed Stranger were recorded on July 24, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), Buddy Harman (drums), and the Anita Kerr Singers (background vocals). The Wreck Of The Old 97 was recorded on July 21, 1959 at RCA Victor Studio in Nashville, Tenn., produced by Chet Atkins, and performed by Eddy Arnold (vocals), Chet Atkins (guitar), Velma Smith (guitar), Bob Moore (bass), Buddy Harman (drums), John D. Loudermilk (harmonica), and the Anita Kerr Singers (background vocals).
